Administration.text:
Type: Antihyperlipidemic
Dosage Forms: Tablet, 600mg
Routes of Administration: oral
Common Trade Names: Lopid

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: C
Lactation risk: Infant risk cannot be ruled out
Renal dosing: not recommended in severe renal impairment
Hepatic dosing: contraindicated in hepatic dysfunction

Contraindications.text:
Allergy to class/drug
Concomitant dasabuvir, repaglinide, or simvastatin
Hepatic dysfunction, primary biliary cirrhosis, preexisting gallbladder disease
Severe renal impairment

Common.text:
Abdominal pain, indigestion
Appendicitis
Fatigue, Vertigo
Rash

Abdominal pain, indigestion
Appendicitis
Fatigue, Vertigo
Rash

Abdominal pain, indigestion
Appendicitis
Fatigue, Vertigo
Rash

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: 1.5h
Metabolism: Hepatic. Inhibitor of CYP2C8, OATP1B1, and OAT3, substrate of UGT2B7
Excretion: Mostly renal

Mechanism_of_Action.text: Stimulates peroxisome proliferator activated receptor alpha, which causes a decrease in triglyceride levels and an increase in high-density lipoprotein levels
